metadata.title: USN-3792-1 -- Net-SNMP vulnerability
metadata.description: It was discovered that Net-SNMP incorrectly handled certain certain crafted packets. A remote attacker could possibly use this issue to cause Net-SNMP to crash, resulting in a denial of service.  Update Instructions:  Run `sudo pro fix USN-3792-1` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected by updating your system to the following package versions:  snmptrapd - 5.7.3+dfsg-1.8ubuntu3.1 libsnmp30 - 5.7.3+dfsg-1.8ubuntu3.1 libsnmp-dev - 5.7.3+dfsg-1.8ubuntu3.1 libsnmp-base - 5.7.3+dfsg-1.8ubuntu3.1 snmp - 5.7.3+dfsg-1.8ubuntu3.1 libsnmp-perl - 5.7.3+dfsg-1.8ubuntu3.1 tkmib - 5.7.3+dfsg-1.8ubuntu3.1 snmpd - 5.7.3+dfsg-1.8ubuntu3.1 python-netsnmp - 5.7.3+dfsg-1.8ubuntu3.1 No subscription required
